Peter, the answer is likely yes, evolution can benefit from using 
recurren=
t connections in the CPPN.  The "mirror effect," which can 
also 
be descri=
bed as fractal self-similarity, is theoretically possible to 
achieve, and =
that kind of connective self-similarity may be useful in 
some kinds of cog=
nitive tasks.  

Note however that getting it to work in the right way is a=
 challenge, 
and finding an appropriate task is a challenge as well.  Both =
require 
serious consideration and justification before going this route 
b=
ecause if applied in the wrong context, recurrence can produce 
patterns th=
at appear noisy and disorganized (i.e. chaotic).  While 
that may be useful=
 in the right situtation, sometimes it is simply 
disruptive.

ken
